data.title: Books Received
data.text:
In lieu of an abstract, here is a brief excerpt of the content:

NWSA Journal 13.1 (2001) 210-217

[Access article in PDF]

Books Received: February 2000-July 2000

Abraham, Margaret. SPEAKING THE UNSPEAKABLE: MARITAL VIOLENCE AMONG SOUTH ASIAN IMMIGRANTS IN THE UNITED STATES. New Brunswick, NJ: Rutgers University Press, 2000.

Adickes, Sandra E. TO BE YOUNG WAS VERY HEAVEN: WOMEN IN NEW YORK BEFORE THE FIRST WORLD WAR. New York: St. Martin's Press, 1997.

Alberti, Pilar, Marta Mercado, Jo Rowlands, Janet Townsend, and Emma Zapata, eds. WOMEN AND POWER: FIGHTING PATRIARCHIES AND POVERTY. New York: Zed Books, 2000.

Allen, James Smith. POIGNANT RELATIONS:THREE MODERN FRENCH WOMEN. Baltimore, MD: Johns Hopkins University Press, 2000.

Allyn, David. MAKE LOVE, NOT WAR THE SEXUAL REVOLUTION: AN UNFETTERED HISTORY. New York: Little, Brown, 2000.

Awkard, Michael. SCENES OF INSTRUCTION: A MEMOIR. Durham, NC: Duke University Press, 2000.

Backscheider, Paula R., ed. REVISING WOMEN: EIGHTEENTH-CENTURY "WOMEN'S FICTION" AND SOCIAL ENGAGEMENT. Baltimore, MD: The Johns Hopkins University Press, 2000.

Bamford, Karen. SEXUAL VIOLENCE ON THE JACOBEAN STAGE. New York: St. Martin's Press, 2000.

Banks, Elizabeth. THE REMAKING OF AN AMERICAN. Gainesville: University Press of Florida, (1928) 2000.

Banks, Ingrid. HAIR MATTERS: BEAUTY, POWER, AND BLACK WOMEN'S CONSCIOUSNESS. New York: New York University Press, 2000.

Barlowe, Jamie. THE SCARLET MOB OF SCRIBBLERS: REREADING HESTER PRYNNE. Carbondale: Southern Illinois Press, 2000.

Barnes, Teresa A. "WE WOMEN WORKED SO HARD": GENDER, URBANIZATION AND SOCIAL REPRODUCTION IN COLONIAL HARARE, ZIMBABWE, 1930-1956. Westport, CT: Greenwood Publishing Group, 1999.

Barr, Marleen S., ed. FUTURE FEMALES, THE NEXT GENERATION. Lanham, MD: Rowman and Littlefield, 2000.

Barros, Carolyn A., and Johanna M. Smith. LIFE-WRITINGS BY BRITISH WOMEN, 1660- 1815. Boston: Northeastern University Press, 2000.

Benbow-Pfalzgraf, Taryn, ed. AMERICAN WOMEN WRITERS: A CRITICAL REFERENCE GUIDE FROM COLONIAL TIMES TO THE PRESENT. Boston: St. James Press, 2000.

Birke, Lynda. FEMINISM AND THE BIOLOGICAL BODY. New Brunswick, NJ: Rutgers University Press, 2000.

Birrel, Susan, and Mary G. McDonald. READING SPORT: CRITICAL ESSAYS ON POWER AND REPRESENTATION. Boston: Northeastern University Press, 2000.

Bishop, Wendy. THE SUBJECT IS READING: ESSAYS BY TEACHERS AND STUDENTS. Portsmouth, NH: Boynton/Cook Publishers, 2000.

Blackwood, Evelyn. WEBS OF POWER: WOMEN, KIN AND COMMUNITY IN A SUMATRAN VILLAGE. Lanham, MD: Rowman and Littlefield, 1999.

Boehmer, Ulrike. THE PERSONAL AND THE POLITICAL: WOMEN'S ACTIVISM IN RESPONSE TO THE BREAST CANCER AND AIDS EPIDEMICS. Albany: State University Press of New York, 2000.

Boxer, Marilyn J., and Jean H. Quataert. CONNECTING SPHERES: EUROPEAN WOMEN IN A GLOBALIZING WORLD, 1500 TO THE PRESENT. 2nd Ed. New York: Oxford University Press, 1999.

Brabeck, Mary M., ed. PRACTICING FEMINIST ETHICS IN PSYCHOLOGY. Washington, D.C.: American Psychological Association, 2000.

Brand, Peg Zeglin, ed. BEAUTY MATTERS. Bloomington: Indiana University Press, 2000.

Brewster, Susan. TO BE AN ANCHOR IN THE STORM: A GUIDE FOR FAMILIES AND FRIENDS OF ABUSED WOMEN. Seattle, WA: Seal Press, 2000.

Brownley, Martime Watson. DEFERRALS OF DOMAIN: CONTEMPORARY WOMEN NOVELISTS AND THE STATE. New York: St. Martin's Press, 2000.

Buker, Eloise A. TALKING FEMINIST POLITICS: CONVERSATIONS ON LAW, SCIENCE, AND THE POSTMODERN. Lanham, MD: Rowman and Littlefield, 1999.

Butalia, Urvashi. THE OTHER SIDE OF SILENCE: VOICES FROM THE PARTITION OF INDIA. Durham, NC: Duke University Press, 2000.

Caulfield, Sueann. IN DEFENSE OF HONOR: SEXUAL MORALITY, MODERNITY, AND NATION IN EARLY TWENTIETH-CENTURY BRAZIL. Durham, NC: Duke University Press, 2000.

Chang, Kang-i Sun, and Haun Saussy, eds. WOMEN WRITERS OF TRADITIONAL CHINA: AN ANTHOLOGY OF POETRY AND CRITICISM. Stanford, CA: Stanford University Press, 2000.

Charles, Nickie. FEMINISM, THE STATE AND SOCIAL POLICY. New York: St. Martin's Press, 2000.

Chu, Patricia P. ASSIMILATING ASIANS: GENDERED STRATEGIES OF AUTHORSHIP IN ASIAN AMERICA. Durham, NC: Duke University Press, 2000.

Coombs, Felicity, and Suzanne Gemmell. PIANO LESSONS: APPROACHES TO THE PIANO. Bloomington: Indiana University Press, 2000.

Crew, Hilary S. IS IT REALLY MOMMIE DEAREST? DAUGHTER-MOTHER NARRATIVES IN YOUNG ADULT FICTION. Lanham, MD: Scarecrow Press, 2000.

Crow, Barbara, ed. RADICAL FEMINISM: A DOCUMENTARY READER. New York: New York University Press, 2000.

Culleton, Claire. WORKING-CLASS CULTURE, WOMEN, AND BRITAIN, 1914-1921. New York: St. Martin's Press, 2000.
